description.para: Specifies the format of the source document. The value gzip (default) results in a document compressed using the GZIP format.
Support for any other compression format is implementation-defined and therefore dependent on the XProc processor used.
Before the document is compressed, it is first serialized (as if written to disk). This option can supply a map with serialization properties, controlling this serialization.
Parameters controlling the compression. Keys, values and their meaning depend on the value of the method option and the XProc processor used.

summary.para: The step serializes the document appearing on its source port and outputs a compressed version of this on its result port.

description.para: The step first serializes the document appearing on its source. It then compresses the outcome of this serialization using the format as specified in the format option. The result, usually a binary document, appears on its result port.
The only compression format that must be supported is GZIP. Support for any other compression format is implementation-defined and therefore dependent on the XProc processor used.
The reverse uncompress operation is supported by the step.

detail.para: Exceptions are the content-type document-property which is updated accordingly and the serialization document-property which is removed.
